IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: OUR MISSION IS TO EXTEND CHRIST'S CALL TO LOVE YOUR NEIGHBOR THROUGH HOUSING, HEALTH CARE AND CRISIS INTERVENTION FOR CHILDREN, FAMILIES AND OLDER ADULTS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: OUR MISSION IS TO EXTEND CHRIST'S CALL TO LOVE YOUR NEIGHBOR THROUGH HOUSING, HEALTH CARE AND CRISIS INTERVENTION FOR CHILDREN, FAMILIES AND OLDER ADULTS. ALSO PROVIDES CORPORATE OVERSIGHT AND SERVICES TO FIVE NON-PROFIT ENTITIES (SEE RELATED PARTIES).
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDE LIFE LEASE UNITS FOR ELDERLY - 215 UNITS

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: PROVIDE HOMES FOR ABUSED AND ABANDONED CHILDREN

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHRISTIAN CITY, INC. AND EACH OF ITS CONSOLIDATED SUBSIDIARIES ARE NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS EXEMPT FROM TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THERE IS, THEREFORE, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IN THESE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. ANNUALLY, THE ORGANIZATION FILES FORM 990, RETURN OF ORGANIZATIONS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX, WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE. THIS FORM IS OPEN FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION. THE ORGANIZATION BELIEVES THAT IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ALL TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
THE CEO'S COMPENSATION IS APPROVED BY A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. COMPARISON TO INDUSTRY DATA SOURCES ARE USED FOR PAY COMPARABILITY.
THE NUMBER LISTED IN COLUMN B INDICATES THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS.

ON SEPTEMBER 28, 2017, CHRISTIAN CITY, INC. MERGED WITH CHRISTIAN CITY HOME FOR CHILDREN, INC. (HFC), A LICENSED RESIDENTIAL CARE FACILITY FOR ABUSED AND ABANDONED CHILDREN AND CHILDREN IN TRANSITION FROM FOSTER CARE TO INDEPENDENCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS EMAILED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE MEMBERS FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST EITHER WHEN THEY ARISE OR AT THE NEXT BOARD MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SALARIES FOR THE CEO AND ANY KEY EMPLOYEES ARE PAID IN PART BY RELATED ORGANIZATIONS. THE CEO'S AND ANY KEY EMPLOYEES' COMPENSATION IS APPROVED BY A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. COMPARISON TO INDUSTRY DATA SOURCES ARE USED FOR PAY COMPARABILITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, TAX RETURNS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE PROVIDED TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
CONSOLIDATION OF CHRISTIAN CITY HOME FOR CHILDREN, INC. 2,493,484. REVALUATION OF CONTROLLING INTEREST IN JOINT VENTURE -1,137,667.
